content.question: What conclusion can be drawn from the data presented in the figure about sensitivity to teratogens during prenatal development?

choices.label: Teratogens do not affect prenatal development of external genitalia.
The arms and legs are susceptible to defects due to teratogens throughout all of prenatal development.
The time period of 3 weeks to 9.5 weeks poses the greatest sensitivity to teratogens for development of teeth.
Teratogens are least likely to impact the development of the heart after 9 weeks.

content.answer: Teratogens are least likely to impact the development of the heart after 9 weeks.

skill.text: 3.C: Interpret quantitative or qualitative inferential data from a given table, graph, chart, figure, or diagram.
